qas.question: What did Prime Minister Jose Socrates announce on April 6, 2011?

answers.text: that the country would request financial assistance from the IMF and the European Financial Stability Facility

qas.question: How many times has Portugal requested external financial support?
What provoked the first request from Portugal for financial support?
For what reason did Moody's Investor Services downgrade nine Portuguese banks in 2011?

context: On 6 April 2011, after his proposed "Plan for Stability and Growth IV" (PEC IV) was rejected by the Parliament, Prime Minister José Sócrates announced on national television <a0_0>that the country would request financial assistance from the IMF and the European Financial Stability Facility<a0_0/>, as Greece and the Republic of Ireland had done previously. It was the <a1_0>third<a1_0/> time that the Portuguese government had requested external financial aid from the IMF—the first occasion occurred in the late 1970s following the <a2_0>Carnation's Revolution<a2_0/>. In October 2011, Moody's Investor Services downgraded nine Portuguese banks due to <a3_0>financial weakness<a3_0/>.
